Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: Draw an outline of one land habitat, like a playground or garden, but with limited or incorrect features. (e.g., may draw a sandbox and call it a garden)
Include a few living things without labels or incorrect labels. (e.g., draw trees but not label them)
CANNOT: Draw and label a water habitat accurately. (student doesnâ€™t include it or draws a land feature like a parking lot instead)
Clearly identify different living things found in each habitat. (confusion between plant and animal types or no clear distinctions)
Show patterns by comparing types of living things in different habitats. (fails to recognize or depict differences between habitats)
Represent organization within the habitat, possibly placing living things in unrealistic or incorrect locations (e.g., fish outside the pond)
Use observations from media or firsthand investigations to inform drawings, which may result in details being incorrect or unrealistic (e.g., palm trees in a forest habitat)
